revision.text:
{{DISPLAYTITLE:muCommander}} {{Infobox software | name = muCommander | logo = [[File:MuCommander icon.png|64px]] | caption = muCommander 0.8.5 screenshot | screenshot = [[File:MuCommander screenshot.png|320px]] | developer = [[Maxence Bernard]] | latest_release_version = 0.9.0 | latest_release_date = {{Start date and age|2012|08|05}} | operating_system = [[Unix-like]], [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Mac OS X]] | genre = [[File manager]] | programming_language = [[Java (programming language)|Java]] | license = [[Free software]] ([[GNU General Public License|GPL v3]])<ref> {{cite web | url = http://trac.mucommander.com/wiki/License | title = muCommander License | date = 2009-06-20 | author = Maxence Bernard | quote = muCommander is released under the terms of the GNU General Public License[...] Version 3, 29 June 2007^ | accessdate = 2012-10-19 }} </ref> | website = [http://www.mucommander.com/ www.mucommander.com] }} '''muCommander''' is a lighweight, cross-platform [[file manager]] that will run on any operating system supporting [[Java (programming language)|Java]]. It features a [[Norton Commander]] style, dual-pane interface to allow easy manipulation of files with many keyboard shortcuts. Pre-compiled builds are available for [[Mac OS X]], [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Linux]], [[Solaris (operating system)|Solaris]], [[FreeBSD]], [[OpenVMS]], and the software can be run from the Internet via [[Java Web Start]].
In 2009, muCommmander was recognized as one of the best file managers on Linux.<ref> {{cite web |url=http://www.techradar.com/news/software/applications/6-best-orthodox-file-managers-for-linux-605506?artc_pg=2 6 best orthodox file managers for Linux |title=6 best orthodox file managers for Linux, Mayank Sharma, TechRadar (June 8, 2009). |accessdate=2010-04-02}} </ref> In 2010, it ranked 76th on the best free software list of PCMag.<ref> {{cite web |url=http://www.pcmag.com/article2/0,2817,2361888,00.asp |title=PC Mag Best Free Software list for 2010 |accessdate=2010-04-02}} </ref>
== Features == * Copy, move, rename and batch rename, email files * Works on local file volumes, [[File Transfer Protocol|FTP]], [[File_Transfer_Protocol#SFTP|SFTP]], [[Server Message Block|SMB]], [[Network File System (protocol)|NFS]], [[HTTP]], [[Amazon S3]], [[Hadoop]] [[Hierarchical Data Format|HDF5]] and [[Bonjour (software)|Bonjour]] * Supports [[ZIP (file format)|ZIP]], [[RAR]], [[7z]], [[Tar (file format)|TAR]], [[Gzip]], [[BZip2]], ISO/[[NRG (file format)|NRG]], AR/[[Deb (file format)|Deb]] and LST archives * ZIP file modification on the fly * File splitting and combining * Change permissions and date of files * Calculate files checksums in [[MD5]], [[CRC32]], [[Secure Hash Algorithm|SHA]], [[SHA-256]], [[SHA-384]], [[SHA-512]], [[Adler32]], [[MD2 (cryptography)|MD2]] * Internationalization for 23 languages * Full keyboard access
== See also == {{Portal|Free software}}
* [[Comparison of file managers]]
==References== <references/>
==External links== * [http://www.mucommander.com/ The official site]
